Title: Prawn and Avocado Omelette
Description: Your average omelette gets a spring update in this fresh recipe.
Instructions: Crack the eggs into a mixing bowl, add a tablespoon of milk and a pinch of salt and pepper, and whisk until well beaten.
Heat a large non-stick frying pan over medium heat and add a tablespoon of butter or oil. Swirl the pan to coat the bottom evenly.
Once the butter has melted or oil is hot, pour in the beaten eggs, and let them cook for a minute or until the edges start to set.
Add the sliced avocado, cooked prawns, and grated cheddar cheese to one side of the omelette.
Use a spatula to fold the other side of the omelette over the filling.
Cook for another minute or until the cheese has melted, and the filling is heated through.
Use a spatula to carefully slide the omelette onto a plate.
Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Serve hot and enjoy your delicious prawn and avocado omelette!
Ingredients: 1 cup mixed herbs, chopped (we used chives and parsley), plus extra to serve
3 spring onions, finely chopped, plus extra thinly sliced to serve
2 cups leafy greens, such as baby spinach or chopped silverbeet
12 medium cooked wild prawns, peeled and cleaned
Thinly sliced green chilli & lime wedges, to serve

Title: Katsu Curry
Description: Katsu Curry (Japanese Curry with Tonkatsu Nuggets and Fried Egg)
Instructions: Make the curry powder by toasting cardamom pods, cinnamon pieces, bay leaf, mustard seeds, coriander seeds, fennel seeds, cumin seeds, fenugreek seeds, whole cloves, and black peppercorns. Grind the mixture in a spice grinder until a fine powder forms. Add ground ginger, turmeric, salt, paprika, and cayenne, and whisk to combine.

Make the curry by whisking mochiko and broth to form a slurry. Cook onion, ginger, and garlic, then add broth, soy sauce, ketchup, honey, lemon juice, salt, and curry powder. Add the slurry and cook until the mixture thickens. Process the mixture until smooth, season with salt, and simmer for 5 minutes.
Make the quick cucumber pickle by placing cucumbers in a bowl with sugar and salt. Pour out excess brine, add lemon juice, and toss to combine.
Make the tonkatsu nuggets by heating oil in a Dutch oven, then trimming and flattening pork chops. Dredge in flour, egg, and panko, then fry until golden brown. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.

Reheat the curry and divide rice among bowls. Spoon the curry over half of each bowl and place the tonkatsu nuggets on the other half. Top with shredded cabbage, lemon wedges, cilantro, and a fried egg. Serve with the quick cucumber pickle.
Ingredients: 1 (2-inch) cinnamon stick, broken into small pieces
1 tablespoon brown or black mustard seeds
1 teaspoon cayenne pepper, plus more to taste

Title: Beef Taco
Description: Elevate a pack of beef mince into vibrant tacos. Go to the extra effort of making your own spice mix for even more flavour, and use soft tortillas
Instructions: Prepare the spice mix by toasting and grinding cumin seeds, coriander seeds, and peppercorns. Add remaining ingredients, mix with cornflour and salt, and store in an airtight jar.
Make pickled onions by mixing sliced onions with lime juice and salt, and letting them soften.

Brown minced beef in oil until crispy, then add half of the spice mix and cook for another 2 minutes. Pour in beef stock, reduce heat to simmer, and cook for 10 minutes until thick and rich. Season to taste.

Toast tortillas and serve with the beef mixture, pickled onions, avocado, tomato, cheese, and tortilla chips (optional) in separate bowls for people to assemble their own tacos. Serve with lime wedges.
Ingredients: 1 lime, juiced, plus wedges to serve

Title: Classic Korean Bibimbap
Description: Rice mixed with vegetables, meat, an egg, and chili pepper paste
Instructions: Gather the ingrediants
To begin, you'll need to cook the rice in a rice cooker or on the stove.
Next, give the cucumber strips a salt water bath for 20 minutes.
Drain the cucumber strips using a sieve.
Then, season spinach with 2 teaspoons sesame oil, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, and 1 dash of the sesame seeds.
Season bean sprouts with 2 teaspoons sesame oil, the remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt, and the remaining dash of sesame seeds.
Add a drizzle of oil to a pan over medium-high heat. Sauté the carrots with a dash of salt until tender, but still crunchy, about 2 minutes. Remove from pan and set aside.
Next, sauté the mushrooms with a dash of salt, adding more oil if needed. Cook until soft and lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Remove from pan and set aside.
Add a drizzle of oil to the pan. Sauté the zucchini with a dash of salt until tender, about 4 minutes.
Place the cooked rice in a large bowl and arrange vegetables on top.
If desired, meat, egg, or both can be placed in the center.
Ingredients: 2 cups medium-grain Korean, or Japanese rice
1 large cucumber, sliced into thin strips
1 teaspoon salt, divided, more as needed
1 1/2 cups parboiled spinach, squeezed of excess water
4 teaspoons sesame oil, divided, more as needed
1 1/2 cups blanched mung bean sprouts, squeezed of excess water
10 shiitake mushrooms, rehydrated if dried, sliced
1 medium zucchini, sliced into thin strips
Fried or medium-soft boiled eggs, optional
Gochujang, or red pepper paste, for serving

Title: Healthy Salad Sandwich
Description: This salad sandwich with herb mayo is the perfect quick and easy lunch recipe. Use any fresh vegetables you have to make a delicious, filling meal.
Instructions: Make the herb mayo: Combine the mayonnaise (or yogurt) with lemon juice, fresh herbs, salt and pepper. Blend with an immersion blender or food processor until smooth then set aside.
Prep the vegetables: Thinly slice the tomato, cucumber and red onion and julienne the cucumber.
Assemble the sandwich: Spread a generous amount of the herb mayo onto two slices of bread then top with all your prepped vegetables and cheese. Slice and serve.

Title: Vietnamese Fresh Spring Rolls
Description: Traditional Vietnamese fresh spring rolls (goi cuon) consist of pork, shrimp, lettuce and herbs wrapped in soft chewy rice paper. They are beautiful to look at and great as a refreshing appetizer or even a light meal. Your guests will be impressed!
Instructions: Parboil the pork for a minute, then discard the liquid.

In a clean pot, add ginger, salt, pork, and enough water to cover the pork. Bring to a boil and skim off any foam. Lower heat to maintain a simmer and place the lid slightly askew. Cook for 25-30 minutes until the pork is just cooked through. Transfer to a bowl with iced water to stop the cooking.
Poach the shrimp in boiling water for 2 minutes until they are just cooked through. Place them in a bowl with iced water immediately.
Slice the pork thinly and slice the shrimp in half lengthwise (remove the veins if needed).
Set up a work station with all ingredients and a plate/bowl of clean water. Briefly dip one rice paper wrapper into the water to wet it just enough to make it pliable and then lay it flat.
Add a layer of lettuce, fresh herbs, and vermicelli noodles. Fold left and right corners of the rice paper over the filling.

Place a couple of pork slices right above the veggies and noodles (about the middle of the rice paper) and place two of the shrimp halves above the pork slices (about the top part of the rice paper). Then roll it up away from you.
Place on a serving plate with the shrimp side up. Repeat with remaining filling and wrappers.
Serve immediately with a dipping sauce.
Ingredients: 10 oz pork (choose among pork shoulder, tenderloin or pork belly)
1 lb raw shrimp (I use peel-on shrimp. We need 16 of them)
2 cups soft lettuce, cut into smaller pieces or strips
Other fresh herbs of your choice such as cilantro, mint

Title: Homemade Hotpot
Description: Hot pot is a tasty, festive and communal cooking and dining experience that involves little more than a table set with a portable butane stove, a pot of bubbling broth and platters of raw meat and/or seafood and vegetables.
Instructions: In a large pot, bring 5 quarts of water to a boil. Add the pork bones and boil for 10 minutes. Drain the pork bones and rinse them with cold water. Clean the pot and rinse it with cold water.

Return the pork bones to the clean pot and add enough water to cover the bones by 2 inches. Add the carrot, corn, and daikon. Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to a simmer. Skim the foam and impurities from the surface of the broth.
Add 1 tablespoon of salt to the pot and continue to simmer for 2-3 hours, until the broth is rich and flavorful. Add more salt if needed.
Strain the broth through a fine-mesh strainer into a clean pot. Discard the solids.
To serve, arrange the thinly sliced beef, fish, Napa cabbage, spinach, potato, pumpkin, eggs, tofu, and udon noodles on plates or in bowls.
Bring the hot pot broth to a boil and pour it into a hot pot or a large pot. Set the pot over a portable burner at the dining table.
Each person can then cook their own ingredients in the hot pot. Serve with the dipping sauces and condiments of your choice.
Ingredients: 2 pounds (or 2 each) pork leg bones, cut into 2-inch pieces
1 carrot, peeled and cut into 1-inch chunks
1 ear corn, husks and silks removed and cut into 1-inch pieces
1 small daikon (about 1/2 pound), peeled and cut into 1-inch chunks
1 pound of any white-fleshed fish, such as flounder, cod, haddock, etc., cut into 1-inch cubes
1/2 pound Napa cabbage, cut into bite-size pieces
1 large Yukon gold or russet potato, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch slices
1 small pumpkin, halved, seeded and cut into 1/2-inch slices
One 8-ounce package fish tofu or one 12-ounce package extra-firm tofu (cut the regular tofu into 1/2-inch slices)
Hot Pot dipping sauce: Chinese BBQ sauce, Chilli oil, Oyster sacuce, Sesame paste

Title: Thai Basil and Cilantro Salad
Instructions: Combine cucumbers, shallots and carrots in a medium bowl.
Bring vinegar, sugar and salt to a boil in a small saucepan over medium-high, then pour over vegetables. Toss to coat. Set aside, stirring occasionally, for 15 min
Add basil, cilantro and chili to vegetables and toss to coat. Serve with grilled satay tofu skewers.
Ingredients: 1 285-g pkg carrots, cut into matchsticks (3 cups)
3 cups packed small Thai basil leaves, (or coarsely torn)

Title: Vegan Acai Bowl
Description: The best Acai Bowl is a thick and creamy smoothie made with acai berry and served in a bowl with a variety of delicious toppings. It’s packed with nutrition and easy to make!
Instructions: In a blender, place the berries, banana, acai powder, optional protein source and water/milk. Blend until smooth. Add extra water if needed (most likely you won’t need any).
Place in serving bowl and top with the suggested toppings or your favorite assortment.
Serves 1 large or 2 small
Ingredients: 1 cup frozen berry mix (any combo: blackberries, blueberries, strawberries, raspberries)
1 tablespoon acai berry powder or 1 packet frozen acai puree
3/4 – 1 cup unsweetened non-dairy milk or water, + more as needed
1 tablespoon nut butter, optional for protein
Mix of fresh berries and fruit

Title: Toasted Bread
Instructions: Place bread in toaster for desired amount of time and remove.
Spread butter on hot toast.
Eat and Enjoy!

Title: Curried Rice
Description: Curried rice is a comforting dish that you can whip together with your pantry staples at a moment's notice.
Instructions: Cook the Vegetables. Heat the oil in a large pan to medium heat.
Add the onion, peppers and carrots, and cook for 5 minutes to soften.
Add the Seasonings. Add the garlic and ginger paste and seasonings (add curry powder, coriander, paprika, cumin, turmeric, cardamom, salt and pepper). Stir to coat. Cook, stirring for 1 minute.
Simmer the Rice. Add the rice and stock and stir.

Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover and simmer for 15 minutes, or until the rice has absorbed the liquid and is tender to your preference. If the rice is not done enough, add a bit more water and stock and simmer longer.
Fluff and Garnish. Remove from heat and fluff with a fork. Sprinkle with garam masala, chili flakes, fresh chopped parsley, and serve.
Ingredients: Vegetables: Onion, bell pepper, carrot. I like to add in spicier peppers
Seasonings: Yellow curry powder, ground coriander, paprika, cumin, turmeric, cardamom, salt, and black pepper. Garam masala is added at the end.
Long Grain Rice: Basmati rice or Thai jasmine rice
Water or Stock (or Broth): Chicken broth or vegetable broth is preferred for more flavor, but water is also suitable with the amount of spices used.
Garnish: Red chili flakes, fresh chopped parsley, lemon

Title: Crossing the Bridge Rice Noodles
Description: Enjoy this special Chinese rice noodle soup. A chicken and pork broth is infused with ginger and spices, and poured over noodles, veg, prawns and shredded meat.
Instructions: In a large stockpot bring 1 litre of water to the boil. Add the pork ribs and chicken thighs, and simmer for 15 mins, skimming off any impurities.

Discard the water and drain the meat. Clean the stockpot, then add 2 litres water and return the meat to the pot. Add two pinches of salt and the ground white pepper, ginger, star anise, Szechuan peppercorns and spring onions. Bring to the boil, then simmer, covered, over a medium heat for 1 hr.
Meanwhile, prepare all the condiments by putting them in small dipping bowls.
Once the stock is ready, remove the ribs and chicken and shred the meat using two forks. Strain the stock and discard the spices, spring onions and ginger. Bring the stock to the boil.

Divide the noodles between two large, wide bowls. Garnish around the noodles with the bean curd skin, mushrooms, spring onions, chillies, shallots, Romaine lettuce, spinach, tiger prawns and coriander. Add the shredded cooked meats. Ladle the hot stock over each bowl, covering all the ingredients.
Serve with the condiments and season with your favourites. Eat the noodles, then drink the soup broth at the end.
Ingredients: 1 thumb-sized piece ginger, peeled and sliced
4 spring onions, trimmed and chopped into 2.5cm slices
2 nests cooked vermicelli rice noodles, drizzled with toasted sesame oil
2 large King Trumpet or King Oyster mushrooms, sliced lengthways
1 small handful of rehydrated Wood Ear mushroom strips
2 spring onions, sliced on the angle
2 red chillies, deseeded and finely sliced
2 tbsp freshly sliced chillies in 4 tbsp low-salt light soy sauce
1 tbsp chilli flakes mixed with 1 tbsp sea salt flakes

Title: Roasted Tomatoes
Description: Roasting tomatoes brings out their natural sweetness and intensifies their flavor, making them a versatile ingredient in many dishes. It's also a great way to use up extra tomatoes if you have an abundance of them from your garden or farmer's market.
Instructions: Gather the ingredients. Position a rack in the center of the oven and heat to 450 F.
In a small bowl, combine the oil, vinegar, and garlic. Set aside to let the garlic infuse the liquids while you prepare the tomatoes.
Cut the tomatoes in half lengthwise. Line a medium rimmed baking sheet with foil. Put the tomatoes in the pan, cut side up.
Drizzle the garlic-infused vinegar and oil evenly over the tops of the tomatoes. Season with pepper and salt to taste.
Roast until the tomatoes are tender and golden in places, 20 to 30 minutes.
Once cool, refrigerate the tomatoes in an airtight container for up to 4 days. Reheat in a 400 F oven for about 10 minutes.

To freeze, place the cooled tomatoes in a single layer on a plastic-lined sheet pan, Freeze until solid. Remove from the pan and store in a zip-top freezer bag or container, and use within six months.
Ingredients: 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, more to taste
1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, more to taste

Title: Hard Boiled Eggs
Description: Hard boiled eggs are a simple and classic recipe that involves boiling eggs until the egg whites are set and the yolks are cooked to your desired level of firmness. This recipe is perfect for breakfast, snacks, or as a topping for salads or sandwiches.
Instructions: Place large pot of water on stove at high heat, enough water to cover eggs completely.
Carefully lower eggs into pot and continue to boil for 30 seconds.
Cover tightly, reduce heat to low (water should maintain a bare simmer), and continue cooking for 11 minutes.
Serve immediately if serving hot. If serving cold, immediately place eggs in bowl of ice water and allow to cool for at least 15 minutes before peeling under cool running water.

To peel, first gently tap hard-boiled eggs all over to thoroughly crack the shell,then remove shell under a thin stream of running water. (The water helps get under the shell and lift it off the egg.)

Title: Garlic Lemon Green Beans
Description: Green beans are sautéed with garlic, red pepper flakes, and butter, then finished with lemon zest and salt and pepper to create a flavorful and easy side dish.
Instructions: Blanch green beans in a large stock pot of well salted boiling water until bright green in color and tender crisp, roughly 2 minutes. Drain and shock in a bowl of ice water to stop from cooking.

Heat a large heavy skillet over medium heat. Add the oil and the butter. Add the garlic and red pepper flakes and saute until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the beans and continue to saute until coated in the butter and heated through, about 5 minutes. Add lemon zest and season with salt and pepper.
Ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
